nl.inl.blacklab.index

Class DocumentFormats

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.index.DocumentFormats

  • public class DocumentFormats
extends Object
    Document format registry, for resolving a DocIndexer class given a format identifier (common abbreviation or (qualified) class name).

    • Method Detail

      • registerFactory

        public static void registerFactory(DocIndexerFactory fac)
        Register a new factory. Factories are responsible for creating the docIndexer instances that will perform the indexing of documents. newer factories have priority over older factories in case of name conflicts. If an exception occurs during initialization of the factory, the factory will not be added, and the exception is rethrown.
        Parameters:
        fac -
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - rethrows exceptions occuring during factory initialization

      • registerFormat

        public static void registerFormat(String formatIdentifier,
                                  Class<? extends DocIndexerAbstract> docIndexerClass)

      • registerFormat

        public static void registerFormat(ConfigInputFormat config)

      • registerFormatsInDirectories

        public static void registerFormatsInDirectories(List<File> dirs)
                                         throws InputFormatConfigException
        Throws:
        InputFormatConfigException

      • getFactory

        public static DocIndexerFactory getFactory(String formatIdentifier)
        Returns the factory which will be used to create the DocIndexer registered under this formatIdentifier. This method isn't used in BlackLab itself, but it could be useful for client applications.
        Parameters:
        formatIdentifier -
        Returns:
        the factory if a valid formatIdentifier is provided, null otherwise

      • isSupported

        public static boolean isSupported(String formatIdentifier)
        Check if a particular string denotes a valid document format.
        Parameters:
        formatIdentifier - format identifier, e.g. "tei" or "com.example.MyIndexer"
        Returns:
        true iff a registered factory supports this format

      • list

        @Deprecated
public static List<String> list()
        Deprecated. use getFormats()
        Returns an alphabetically sorted list of registered document formats. Note that though this list will not contain duplicates, duplicates might exist internally (see getFormats()).
        Returns:
        the list of registered formatIdentifiers

      • getFormats

        public static List<DocIndexerFactory.Format> getFormats()
        Returns a list of all registered document formats for all factories, ordered by descending priority. Note that this list might contain duplicates if multiple factories support the same formatIdentifier, such as when registering extra instances of the builtin factories. In this case, the first of those entries is the one that is actually used.
        Returns:
        the list of registered abbreviations

      • getFormat

        public static DocIndexerFactory.Format getFormat(String formatIdentifier)
        Returns a format descriptor for a specific format
        Parameters:
        formatIdentifier -
        Returns:
        the descriptor, or null if not supported by any factory
